Nibbidā Sutta：1．Nibbidā SuttaThe seven bojjhangas，if cultivated，lead to revulsion，calm and Nibbāna．S．v．82．

2．Nibbidā SuttaThe same as above but with the four iddhi-pādas．S．v．255．

3．Nibbidā SuttaFive things，the perception of which leads to revulsion：foulness of the body，cloying of food，distaste of the world，impermanence in all things and the thought of death．A．iii．83．

4．Nibbidā SuttaCalling to mind the Buddha，the Dhamma，and the Sangha，etc．，conduces to revulsion and to Nibbāna．A．i．30．
